Certainly! Here’s a refined version:

Yes, the vast expanse of our atmosphere appears blue because sunlight enters Earth's atmosphere at an angle (about 60 degrees) due to its composition. This angle causes sunlight to bend around Earth's curvature, creating a blueish appearance when passing through different layers of the atmosphere. Clouds absorb sunlight, scattering it, while dust particles also reflect light
